name: Youve got to learn how to cry

metadata.name: Lesson 1: If you're cold, just find a warm place
metadata.description:
She pointed at them and said, "These birds fly from Siberia." I nodded as if I understood. "It is so cold that they can't live there." She continued explaining, but I didn't concentrate on what she was saying. I planned to tell her how I was feeling.
"I wish I could migrate like a bird. Go wherever I want," she said with the eyes revealing that she was thinking about something. I knew it because I always glanced at her.
"But they need to migrate"
"I need to. I'd also like to move to a warmer place."
"Where?"
"Anywhere, far away from here."
"Because of people around you?"
"Yep."
I didn't tell her anything I wanted. I was not brave enough, and it was the last time I saw her.
She is no longer here, but I am. I remember her and how I felt that day.
I saw her post on Instagram, wearing many layers of sweaters, and taking selfies with a snowman. I know it was freezing there, yet her smile and the sparkle in her eyes are brighter and warmer than being in a tropical country like this.
